active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the pros and cons of shifting from traditional 'complexity-focused' password rules (e.g., 8 characters with upper/lower/symbols) to NIST's 'length-focused' guidelines (e.g., 12+ characters, no composition rules). Use real-world breach examples like the 2017 Equifax incident to support your arguments, and consider impacts on user experience and compliance with frameworks like GDPR.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Password Strength Requirements' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Awareness and Training > Security Controls and Best Practices > Authentication and Access Control > Password Strength Requirements). Generate 50 high-quality Anki-style flashcards optimized for spaced repetition, active recall, and Bloom's Taxonomy progression. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding Layers: [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Tie flashcards to discussion/peer teaching/problems (e.g., 'Apply to debate old vs. NIST policies') - NIST SP 800-63B/4 full guidelines: length > complexity, no composition/periodic rules, breach screening, paste allowed, rate-limiting. - Prior knowledge: Link to authentication basics. - Big picture: Risk reduction, compliance (NIST/GDPR). Use Flashcard Schema: [INSERT FULL SCHEMA FROM ABOVE] Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': 1, 'distractors': ['A', 'B', 'C']}}, ...]. Ensure 10 cards per Bloom's level (progressive), varied formats (MCQ 60%, cloze 20%, short answer 20%). Distractors per protocol. No duplicates; cover all voter priorities (completeness, pedagogy).
